author: MIKE VORKUNOV
title: Charles Oakley Is Arrested at Knicks Game After Altercation
text:
Charles Oakley Is Arrested at Knicks Game After Altercation By MIKE VORKUNOV   Charles Oakley, the former Knicks star, was arrested Wednesday after an altercation with security guards at Madison Square Garden during the Knicks’ game against the Los Angeles Clippers . Oakley was removed from his courtside seat midway through the first quarter after being surrounded by guards. Oakley, who was sitting near the Knicks’ owner, James L. Dolan , pushed a guard twice before being restrained and taken away. While he was being walked away from the court, the game stopped briefly as players watched the episode play out. Charles Oakley shoves Madison Square Garden security and is escorted out of the building in strange scene pic.twitter.com/lTphvnSzFV — Sports Illustrated (@SInow) Feb. 9, 2017 The crowd broke into chants of “Oakley! Oakley” as he was being led off. Oakley continued to fume as he stood in the tunnel outside the court. With his hands in cuffs and guards surrounding him, Oakley yelled in anger. “I didn’t do nothing,” he said, mixing in expletives. He said Dolan was responsible — although he did not say for what. SBNY Exclusive: Charles Oakley on the ground surrounded by police and Garden security pic.twitter.com/cemhHF4Lu0 Phil Jackson , the Knicks’ president, walked into the tunnel and to Oakley, trying to calm him down. It did not seem to work, as Oakley continued to vent.
